snippet: Bay Area towns that tech made rich as considering rent control, an urban tactic, to save a middle class squeezed by years of punishing rent increases.
abstract: Activists across San Francisco Bay Area and Silicon Valley are pushing to enact series of rent control proposals, motivated by soaring housing costs driven by tech industry and fears over shrinking middle class; many who say building more housing units would be ideal long-term solution agree that regulation to limit rent is best way to help now; efforts, if successful, could herald largest expansion of tenant laws since 1970s.
lead_paragraph: Bay Area towns that tech made rich as considering rent control, an urban tactic, to save a middle class squeezed by years of punishing rent increases.

headline.main: In Silicon Valley Suburbs, Calls to Limit the Soaring Rents
headline.print_headline: In Towns That Tech Made Rich, Calls to Limit the Soaring Rents
